com.qozix.layouts

Class AnchorLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • ViewGroup
      • com.qozix.layouts.AnchorLayout
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TranslationLayout

    public class AnchorLayout
extends ViewGroup
    The AnchorLayout positions it's children using absolute pixel values, offset by anchors. An anchor exists on each axis (x and y), and is determined by multiplying the relevant dimension of the child (width for x, height for y) by a float. This float can be supplied to each child via LayoutParams, or to the AnchorLayout ViewGroup directly. If a child's LayoutParams are not specified (null), then it will be positioned using the Layout's anchor values. For example, passing an -0.5f anchorX and -1.0f anchorY will position the view entirely above, and centered horizontally, relative to the pixel coordinates supplied. This is useful for positioning elements as indicators for another view, or graphical feature. Tooltips, map markers, instructional elements, etc could benefit from anchored layouts.

    • Method Detail

      • setAnchors

        public void setAnchors(float aX,
              float aY)
        Sets the anchor values used by this ViewGroup if it's children do not have anchor values supplied directly (via LayoutParams)
        Parameters:
        aX - (float) x-axis anchor value (offset computed by multiplying this value by the child's width
        aY - (float) y-axis anchor value (offset computed by multiplying this value by the child's height
